intro: Dendropanax latilobus, commonly known as the broad-lobed arrowwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in the Appalachian region. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with broad, rounded lobes and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Dendropanax latilobus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
